org.vaadin.addons.criteriacontainer
Class CriteriaQueryDefinition<ItemEntity>

java.lang.Object
  org.vaadin.addons.criteriacore.AbstractCriteriaQueryDefinition<javax.persistence.Tuple>
      org.vaadin.addons.beantuplecontainer.BeanTupleQueryDefinition
          org.vaadin.addons.criteriacontainer.CriteriaQueryDefinition<ItemEntity>
Type Parameters:
ItemEntity - the Entity type for the BeanItems
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.vaadin.addons.lazyquerycontainer.QueryDefinition
public class CriteriaQueryDefinition<ItemEntity>
extends BeanTupleQueryDefinition

Definition of a JPA 2.0 Criteria query. The query can be arbitrary, but the first item in the tuple returned must be an entity of type T, which will be used to create the items returned by the container.

Author:
jflamy

                               boolean applicationManagedTransactions,

Parameters:
entityManager - the EntityManager to reach the database that contains T objects
applicationManagedTransactions - true unless using J2EE container-managed transactions
batchSize - how many items are retrieved at once
itemEntityClass - class for the entities that underlie the items (T)

Parameters:
entityManager - the EntityManager to reach the database that contains T objects
detachedEntities - if true, entities will be detached from the persistence context and merged as needed.
applicationManagedTransactions - true unless using J2EE container-managed transactions
batchSize - how many items are retrieved at once
itemEntityClass - class for the entities that underlie the items (T)

defineQuery

protected javax.persistence.criteria.Root<?> defineQuery(javax.persistence.criteria.CriteriaBuilder criteriaBuilder,
                                                         javax.persistence.criteria.CriteriaQuery<?> criteriaQuery)
Define the default query that fetches all items of type BeanTupleQueryDefinition.getSelectQuery() and BeanTupleQueryDefinition.getCountQuery() will take into account the filters and sorting orders defined by the query definition by enriching/amending the criteriaQuery

Specified by:
defineQuery in class BeanTupleQueryDefinition
Parameters:
criteriaBuilder - the CriteriaBuilder used to define the from, where and select
criteriaQuery - the CriteriaQuery to build the tuples,
Returns:
a root of the query (used for counting the lines returned)
See Also:
BeanTupleQueryDefinition.defineQuery(javax.persistence.criteria.CriteriaBuilder, javax.persistence.criteria.CriteriaQuery)

getPropertyId

public String getPropertyId(Class<?> metamodelType,
                            javax.persistence.metamodel.SingularAttribute<?,?> attr)
Return the attribute name as created in the BeanItem. This override is needed because we return a BeanItem for the entity and not a BeanTupleItem. Therefore the type name or alias must not be present.

Overrides:
getPropertyId in class BeanTupleQueryDefinition
Parameters:
metamodelType - the static metamodel in which the attribute is found.
attr - a singular attribute defined in the model
Returns:
a propertyId
See Also:
BeanTupleQueryDefinition.getPropertyId(java.lang.Class, javax.persistence.metamodel.SingularAttribute)

getPropertyId

public String getPropertyId(String alias,
                            javax.persistence.metamodel.SingularAttribute<?,?> attr)
Compute the property id from information available in the static metamodel. This override is needed because we return a BeanItem for the entity and not a BeanTupleItem. In this case, we simply return the property id, and not the qualified name.

Overrides:
getPropertyId in class BeanTupleQueryDefinition
Parameters:
alias - alias used in the query definition.
attr - a singular attribute defined in the model
Returns:
a propertyId if it has been found in the defined properties, null if not.
